index.head: APPLICATION OF LINEAR FUNCTION
index.screenText:
EXAMPLE 2:
The initial cost of a kilogram of apples was $1.50, but the cost of a kilogram of apples has been increasing at 5 cents a year. The total cost (y) (in dollars) of a kilogram of apples over time can be represented as a function of the total number of years (x) since the initial cost thus:
y = 1.50 + 0.05x
(here m = $0.05 of increase per kg and c = $1.50 per kg, initial cost)
Observe graph to see relationship between costs of production, with respect to per unit produces.
